title: iPhone 15 Pro Max: titanium, Action Button, and USB-C
description: Weve just had our first chance to check out the new iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max. There are lots of new things about the devices  camera upgrades, the new A17 Bionic chip  but there are three things about the phone you notice right away. The thing is made of titanium; theres an Action Button on the left side; and thats a USB-C port on the bottom. #Apple #iPhone15 #Technology   Subscribe:  Subscribe:  Like The Verge on Facebook:  Follow on Twitter:  Follow on Instagram:  Follow on TikTok:   The Vergecast Podcast:  Decoder with Nilay Patel:   More about our podcasts:   Read More:  Community guidelines:  Wallpapers from The Verge:   Subscribe to The Vergecast on YouTube, new episodes on Wednesday and Friday:
transcript: (upbeat music) - I just saw the new iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 15 Pro Max, and the new 15 and 15 Plus. And the big story that Apple kind of glossed over in the Keynote is that they all have USB C. Lightning port is dead. Long live lightning. The Pro and the Pro Max get USB 3 speeds. So you'll get up to 10 gigabits per second when you're transferring data between your phone and your laptop. 15 and 15 Plus don't get that. They just get USB C, but this means that you'll be able to charge your laptop, your iPad, your iPhone, all using the same charger. It's a beautiful thing. Thank you, Apple. So it really was the Pro show this year. The Pro and the Pro Max got the biggest upgrades. Not too surprising, but the big word of the day is titanium. That's the new material that they're made out of instead of the stainless steel from last year. And it is a whole lot lighter. It's 19 grams lighter on each the Pro and the Pro Max and you feel that in your hand when you're trying these phones out. Something else I noticed that I liked, the edges of the phones are a little more rounded now. The 14 Pro had a real straight serious edge. The 15 Pro is just a little bit more comfortable in the hand. Also new this time around is the action button. So that takes the place of the mute switch and if you're worried about the mute switch going away, I have good news. It does mute your notifications by default. You can also program it to do a bunch of other things like open the camera app or run a shortcut, open an app, or do the flashlight. There's a lot of options and I'm pretty excited to play with it. So the big camera news this year is on the Pro Max. That's the one that gets the five times telephoto lens. The Pro sticks with the three times lens, so you gotta upgrade to the big phone if you want more zoom reach. So counting the macro and the ultra wide and the telephoto and the crop options, you get seven lenses on the iPhone 15 Pro Max. Tapping on the main camera icon will give you a few more focal length options. So it really feels like a feature for photographers. Also, for the first time when you're taking photos and it recognizes a person or a pet, it'll automatically save the depth information so you can choose a portrait mode effect afterwards. You don't necessarily have to be in portrait mode, which is cool. The iPhone 15 and the 15 Plus of course get dynamic island. That's a pill shaped notch at the top of screen that has your timer, your Uber ride, all that cool information. Couple other updates, they get the A16 bionic chip, that was the new one from last year, and they get the 48 megapixel main camera sensor that was in last year's Pro models. So Apple is just kind of stepping these up to where the 14 Pro was. So next year action button on the iPhone 16? Yeah, I'm hoping for it. I think it's gonna be a good thing. They're all up for pre-order this Friday, September 15th, and they're shipping September 22nd. So most of the prices stayed the same this year. It's $799 for the iPhone 15, $899 for the Plus, $999 for the Pro. But the Pro Max goes up to $1,199. So you're gonna have to shell out for that five times zoom. Did I say we or I? Does it matter? Okay. Hi. All right.
